data.title: Biome map generator
data.body:
Among all new features of the upcoming new map editor (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2805), there could also be a "Biome map generator".

What is a "biome" ?
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biome

One of the most famous example of games that use a biome map generator is Minecraft. http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/Biome

It would be useful to have such a tool in OpenRA Map Editor. This would fasten the creation of maps for modders.

Reference documentation : 

http://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/20551/a-simple-map-four-biomes-and-how-to-distribute-them

http://www-cs-students.stanford.edu/~amitp/game-programming/polygon-map-generation/
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/136943-biome-map-generator?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: New Map Editor : summary of ideas
data.body:
A new map editor (with a new GUI, new features, new options ...) might be a good idea to help modders create maps. Here is what it could look like:

Mockup:
![552273ScreenShot001](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311062/92078b1c-972f-11e2-8d82-aaad440133f6.png)
- [x] a toolbar with buttons like: 
  new map, open map, save, save as, import, export, undo, redo, show/hide grid, zoom, pan, add tile, fill, erase, tile finder, palette, map properties, resize map... (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2825)
- [ ] tabs (to be able to load several maps and work on several projects in only one window)
  (posted in a separate issue: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2826)
- [ ] an embedded .yaml file viewer (and editor ?) (see #2438 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2827)
  ![707453ScreenShot002](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311063/9b32fd20-972f-11e2-8f85-f09c39126b41.png)
- [ ] a sub-menu to load third party software like SHP Viewer or TileSet Builder ... (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2828)
- [ ] a new GUI with dockable panels (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2829)
- [ ] horizontal & vertical scrollbars around the map (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2830)
- [ ] layers (to group several tiles together and maybe with the pan tool, move all them all (the whole group) at once). (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2831)
  ![831760ScreenShot006](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311065/a2eec602-972f-11e2-89a7-7998a35b1724.png)
- [ ] history (undo actions) (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2832)
  ![974503ScreenShot005](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311066/aab31744-972f-11e2-930d-0bd7295de978.png)
- [ ] map file browser (to easily find maps and open them in the editor) (see  #2658 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2833)
  ![730456ScreenShot003](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311070/bd3903ce-972f-11e2-82e6-08adbb999ce2.png)
- [ ] tileset file browser (similar to the map file browser above) (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2834)
  ![349266ScreenShot004](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311071/c9d488a6-972f-11e2-9796-cf574aa8ad03.png)
- [ ] biome map generator (#2806)
- [ ] drag and drop .oramap files from the OS to the editor to load them (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2835)

data.title: Test Build(20130316) - BuildSpeed not affected by changing System.yaml
data.body:
Using test build "20130316", I edited the System.yaml to increase my build times to be much faster (0.1), but these do not seem to be working on the test build as build times seem unaffected.

I tested test same settings on the Stable build and they worked and altered build speeds accordingly.

This was playing a local skirmish against the various AI bots.

If these issues from the test builds should not be posted, my apologies and feel free to close or remove this issue.

data.title: Remove inconsistencies that crash C&C mod
data.body:
- Added tab cycle key to settings GUI as it is user-configurable
- Fixed #2791 don't crash on powerdown hotkey when playing cnc
- Pull cnc sell/repair button hotkeys from settings
- Fixed #2785 don't crash when last player leaves game in cnc

data.title: cancel attack when unit gets teleported
data.body:
When a unit gets teleported away all attacks targeting this unit should be canceled. This is for (at least) two reasons:
- the attacker can't possibly know where the unit has gone
- if units get teleported across islands and attackers try to follow them this leads to a tremendous performance drop because of wayfinding costs

data.title: Press ESC key to cancel/remove the current sentence in a chat
data.body:
During a game, if you press the Enter key, you can start typing a sentence.

But what if the player doesn't want to type a sentence anymore ?
He has to press the backspace key to remove what he typed so far.

Pressing the ESC key to cancel/remove the current sentence in a chat could be useful.
(and wouldn't display the Options menu neither... But pressing ESC one more time would).

data.title: Word jump and selection with CTRL (+SHIFT) + arrow key in lobby
data.body: In the lobby chat, the user should be able to perform several actions related to words and selection: - [ ] jump to the start of the sentense with CTRL+Home - [ ] jump to the end of the sentense with CTRL+End - [ ] jump to previous word with CTRL+left arrow - [ ] jump to next word with CTRL+right arrow - [ ] select the whole sentense (and see the selection) with CTRL+SHIFT+Home - [ ] select the whole sentense (and see the selection) with CTRL+SHIFT+End - [ ] select the previous word (and see the selection) with CTRL+SHIFT+left arrow - [ ] select the next word (and see the selection) with CTRL+SHIFT+right arrow

data.title: Minimap and unit selection bug
data.body:
1. Create a radar
2. Click on the minimap and move the rectangle (on the minimap) to change the battlefield view.
3. Without releasing your left mouse button, move your cursor somewhere else (for example on the battlefield view).

You'll notice that the rectangle unit selection has already been created at the minimap's position (when you tried to move the view with the minimap).

I think that if a player clicks on the minimap, OpenRA shouldn't start the unit selection.
It should detect if the cursor is over the minimap or over the battlefield view.

Playtest 20130316 

<bountysource-plugin>

---

data.title: Units with AttackFrontal should alternate fire from different LocalOffsets
data.body:
A turreted unit with two localoffsets fires from one location, and then from the other (e.g. Mammoth Tank fires from each of its two barrels, in succession).
But this behavior does not apply to AttackFrontal, even if you define two LocalOffsets. It would be good if this worked for AttackFrontal, too. Some frontal units have a need for two local offsets (e.g. Flame Tank), so that they can alternate fire from each weapon source.

data.title: Support for more weapons
data.body:
While the official mods shipping with OpenRA might not need it, more than two weapon slots could be useful for several other mods (including one I'm working on).

After Tertiary, I continued with Weapon4-9, as quaternary, quinary and so on are just asking for typos, much more difficult to remember and far less copy-paste-friendly.

NOTE: I did test this, and it seems to work fine, but I'm not a programmer, this was done by copy-pasting + trial & error. I'm particularly unsure about the MathMax part, I have no idea whether it really works as intended.

NOTE2: This feature would become more useful if someone could implement customizable per-turret graphics, so that Secondary and beyond can use different turret graphics instead of using copies of the first turret. That would allow a large ship to have a small machine gun turret, two large cannon turrets and a missile turret, for example. That's beyond my current abilities, though.

data.title: Unit with veterancy that gets cloak crate has veterancy icon "cloak"
data.body: When a non-cloaking unit picks up a cloak crate but has unit experience, the unit experience logo "cloaks" with the unit. Normally cloaking units have their veterancy icon show up normally.
